content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #192

## May 2019 Ballot Comment:

Submitted by Anthony Julian
Chapter/section: Subscription Response
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: NEG :exclamation: Clarification
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary:

Comment: See Note on ANSI modal verbs. Also, IMHO hub.reason should be Required, and returning the description of the error SHALL be mandatory.

Existing wording: If a Hub finds any errors in the subscription request, an appropriate HTTP error response code (4xx or 5xx) MUST be returned. In the event of an error, the Hub SHOULD return a description of the error in the response body as plain text, used to assist the client developer in understanding the error. This is not meant to be shown to the end user. Hubs MAY decide to reject some callback URLs or topic URIs based on their own policies.
Proposed wording: If a Hub finds any errors in the subscription request, an appropriate HTTP error response code (4xx or 5xx) SHALL be returned. In the event of an error, the Hub SHOULD return a description of the error in the response body as plain text, used to assist the client developer in understanding the error. This is not meant to be shown to the end user. Hubs MAY decide to reject some callback URLs or topic URIs based on their own policies.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

hl7-fhircast-bot labeled Issue #192

isaacvetter commented on Issue #192

NOTE on ANSI modal verbs: The usage of ANSI modal verbs consistently provides a vehicle for quickly discerning the conformance criteria.
HL7 adheres to ISO/IEC directive, Appendix G: ANSI modal verbs ("SHALL", "SHOULD", "MAY", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD NOT", "MAY NOT") SHALL be capitalized. See FHIR conformance rules, section 2.1.0.1 "Conformance Language". http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/conformance-rules.html

wmaethner labeled Issue #192

wmaethner commented on Issue #192

## Montreal May 2019 Working Group Vote

Isaac moved the following disposition, seconded by Niklas

Disposition: Persuasive with mod
Disposition Comment: Will update the MUST to SHALL and will leave the error description as a SHOULD because of errors with authentication, for example, and because it follows the web sub model.

:+1: For: 13
:expressionless: Abstain: 0
:-1: Against: 0

:tada: The motion passed! :tada:
